question.title: Google Play warning about 16-KB page size — libgmm-jni.so not supported. How to fix?
question.body:
Google Play is warning that my app does not support 16-KB page size. My app currently supports only 4-KB pages. When I checked my AAB using the APK Analyzer, I found that the file libgmm-jni.so does not support 16-KB page size, and this seems to be causing the warning.

Here is the image from analyzer:

Here are my project settings:

  • Gradle: 8.7
  • AGP: 8.1.3
  • minSdk: 29
  • targetSdk: 35
  • Java compatibility: 1.8
  • NDK: 29.0.14033849 rc4

Has anyone had this issue with libgmm-jni.so? I’m not sure which dependency is adding this .so file or how to update it. Any help would be appreciated.

question_comments.body: This could be tracked also in issuetracker.google.com/459586274. Please check the issue and feel free to leave comments on that bug. A workaround there suggested to exclude libgmm-jni.so from the APK packaging via packagingOptions.
I believe the same issue has been reported to Google, you can follow the discussion in this bug issuetracker.google.com/issues/459586274

You can decompile your APK using Jadx-Gui or apktool and then search for the loadLibrary command that loads this library (if it is directly loaded). If it is loaded by adifferent .so file you can try to make a full-text search on the contained .so files if the string "libgmm-jni" is contained in a different .so file.

If any of your packages don’t support the 16 KB page size, update them to the latest version and try again—this fixed it for me. If the package doesn’t have a 16 KB–compatible release yet, consider switching to an alternative that does.

Not sure if this will help: stackoverflow.com/a/79755345/21185751. I followed it and updated my gradle-wrapper.properties file and specifically this line distributionUrl=https\://services.gradle.org/distributions/g‌​radle-8.14.2-all.zip then it worked!
